result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Outpatient Competency Admission Decision

Defendant James Jeremy Turner in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for James Jeremy Turner.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court has not received an update as to competency. Court orders referral to OCRP. No objection by parties. Review set. Address updated.
Review scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:00 am.

Status conference on September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant James Jeremy Turner in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for James Jeremy Turner.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews competency exam report. Attorney Riniker requests that the court find him not competent at this time but that the defendant will likely regain competency. Attorney Frank heard on competency exam results. Attorney Riniker asks court to adopt recommendations in the report. Attorney Frank heard and requests an evaluation by Outpatient Restoration Program. Court heard and finds defendant currently not competent but could become competent. Will send a referral to department to determine inpatient or outpatient treatment is needed. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Bond amended to signature with conditions per verbal order of court. No objection by State. Attorney Frank could not be contacted.

Preliminary hearing on March 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Lisa Riniker appeared in person for State, Attorney Mark Frank appeared in person for defendant, defendant did not appear. This case was set for March 23. Attorney Frank met with defendant at Grant County Jail and requests waiver of prelim. Victim notification issues addressed. Attorney Frank heard on living arrangements if defendant is released. Attorney Frank has been making contact with possibilities. Court reschedules prelim and bond hearing.

Defendant shall have no contact with L.A.
Defendant shall submit to drug testing upon request of law enforcement and court.

Defendant James Jeremy Turner appeared in court, Attorney Mark Frank appeared by video,  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Attorney Frank represents defendant in 22CM31. State heard and requests $1000 cash bond with conditions to have no contact with Victim 1 and to submit to random drug testing upon request. Attorney Frank heard and requests a signature bond with condition of no acts or threats of violence with L.A. Court heard and order $500 cash bond with a no contact with L.A. and random drug testing upon request for law enforcement or court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
